title: CheatSM! CheatSM! CheatSM!
body:
"Amazing" how Bjerg can still use abilities when he's in the middle of an active Stopwatch.

"Incredible" how he can simultaneously steal two ults to "miraculously" win that last fight.

Unbelievable that suddenly a tank is doing more damage than the ADC.

"Spectacular" that Naut was able to flash twice in a row to avoid getting picked off when he was dead to rights caught.

Rito, make the game fixing less obvious, plz.

replies.body:
I'm gonna need some video evidence of these things you're claiming. Death Timers are still a major problem in LCS, but that's about it. 

Also, always remember that C9 does not care about winning in NA. They only care about winning internationally. They are clearly trolling right now, but at least it's fun. TSM fosters a pretty nasty working environment with a pretty nasty leader in Bjergson who DEMANDS greatness in NA play because he suffers from an inferiority complex in international play. TSM is an embarrassment to the NA region and nothing will change that.

Considering Liquid has won the last three splits, Riot is certainly doing a terrible job cheating for TSM and fixing the games.  Or here's a thought.  Maybe, just maybe mind you, Riot isn't fixing games for them?

I personally can't find the Naut flashing twice but I did see the Sylas {{item:3157}} but it was hard to see but it did look kinda fishy.  

It is kinda funny how many of the League "bugs" are in TSM games.  
Bjergsen couldn't see Huhi's {{champion:136}} balls so Huhi couldn't play Sol in the TSM vs CLG SemiFinals 2016 Summer split. 

When Hakuho bugged out of his teammate's {{champion:13}} ult to only have Ryze be ulted and get 1v3'd or so. 
Bjergsen being able to {{champion:134}} ult two people at the same time.
